sentences.sentence: The Greek coast guard was able to rescue 18 survivors from the first vessel and transported them to the port of Mytilene on the island of Lesbos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Authorities say the boat in distress was located three nautical miles inside Turkey's territorial waters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While Turkish officials were informed of the situation, they did not respond, prompting the Greeks to issue a rescue order.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Athens says the country has seen an increase in migration flows due to summer weather.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Over the weekend, the coast guard located and rescued 98 migrants in three different missions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to UN figures, over 14,000 people have reached Greece by sea or land so far this year, equaling 10 percent of Mediterranean migrant crossings.

sentences.sentence: Ukrainian forces are claiming important advances in their counteroffensive in the Zaporizhia region. Українські військові вважають важливими підвищеннями в їхньому збройному військовому військовому регіоні.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Міністр оборони вважає, що армія повністю знову зберігала контроль за одним з ключових пунктів в центрі різних військових війн в селі Роботіна.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The European Union must be ready to enlarge by 2030. That's what the president of the EU Council said in Slovenia, where he outlined his vision for the bloc to reflect the profound geopolitical shift following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Finally, enlargement is no longer a dream.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's time to move forward.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: There is still a lot of work to do.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It will be difficult. It will be complex, sometimes painful for the future member states and for the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But let's be clear. If we want to be credible, I believe we must talk about timing after russia's illegal invasion in 2022 the eu gave ukraine moldova and bosnia-herzegovina candidate status engagement was also stepped up with other western balkan countries montenegro serbia north macedonia and albania who also are official candidates and george's aspirations are also being taken seriously.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The French president, Emmanuel Macron, on Monday said that the EU needs to reform itself first if it wants to integrate new nations and has to build consensus with more than 30 member countries, which is expected to be a difficult process.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Experts also agree that the momentum is there, but the accession model has to change so that the functioning of the EU itself is preserved.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The enlargement of the European Union, of course, risks bringing at the table more veto-wielding member states and thus slowing down the process of seeking consensus on not the issue so unless decision-making is not reforms like you qualify majority voting streamlined problems of an enlarged Union and it's smooth functioning risk only aggravating at that stage and that will in particular be so if indeed you know issues of rule of law respect for democracy are not well settled in these new member states both Ukraine and Moldova were granted candidate status in June and several voices are calling for the EU to open accession talks by December just one year after prices broke all records, the energy crisis in Europe seems to be over, at least for now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Monthly household bills that ran to hundreds of euros are over for the time being, as prices have now dropped to pre-Ukraine war levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Experts say that while there will be some ups and downs, customers should now have a little more breathing space.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The volatility is always in the order of 5, 10, 20% fluctuation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's nothing as dramatic as we have seen and we are used to now see on the market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We need to remember that the fundamentals are also pretty encouraging when it comes for example with the gas storage. Gas storage in Europe is now full by more than 90% and demand for gas in Europe remains reduced in the order of 20% vis-a-vis the pre-crisis level. A year ago gas prices marked their record high reaching 300 euros per megawatt hour while gas storage facilities were at 79%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This August the situation is much better with prices at 34 euros per megawatt hour and storage facilities almost full.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And that should allow governments to change course.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So while last year governments have jumped into this field by subsidizing energy bills for all, it is now very important not to do that anymore because we are not in the middle of a crisis, but to be very selective and provide targeted support to the most vulnerable in society.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Surprises can't be ruled out this coming winter, but right now observers expect the situation to get better as the EU deepens its energy transition and moves away from its dependency on Russian gas.

Another day, another court hearing for Donald Trump. In Washington, D.C., District Judge Tanya Chutkan set a March 4 trial date for the federal case,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: alleging he tried to overturn the 2020 election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The judge rejected the April 2026 date requested by Trump's lawyers, but set a date later than prosecuting special counsel Jack Smith had requested.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: At home in Berlin, Simon Walfisch is a professional British opera singer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He took the decision to relocate to Germany with his family to overcome what he sees as the barriers to musicians brought about by Brexit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: What used to be possible, get the call on the Friday, turn up on the Monday, start working, in another EU country is now simply not possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And that is infuriating and totally pointless.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: For British musicians, the cost of arranging visas, work permits and additional travel expenses has surged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Schengen visa limitations also restrict professionals to just 90 days in a 180-day period within the EU. The UK-EU trade agreement also lacks provisions for short-term travel for freelance creative professionals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: What we've done is shot ourselves in the foot completely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Simon who continues to perform across Europe sees himself as one of the lucky ones, able to take advantage of his grandmother's German heritage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Anita Lasker-Walfisch, a German-born Jewish Auschwitz survivor, understands and supports her grandson's decision to take up German citizenship.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He is a real European.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: And of course these stupid Brexit people didn't give a thought for anything.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: As far as we are concerned, this is a total practical decision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: German, English, European.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Here at the Royal Albert Hall, the impact of Brexit on the music industry is reverberating.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A recent survey by the Independent Society of Musicians found UK musicians are grappling with dwindling opportunities within the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Half of them report a decline in European-based opportunities since Brexit and a quarter are left with no engagements at all inside the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Sean Patel was too young to vote in the Brexit referendum. A baritone singer recently recruited to work at a Danish opera house only for the opportunity to fall apart due to visa complications.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: They were completely honest. They said because of Brexit, because of my situation as a British citizen, it's going to be more difficult for me to be able to come over. I was their first choice, but unfortunately I just couldn't get it in time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Sean is now going through the process of applying for an EU passport through his Irish heritage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But British musicians who don't have that option are now calling for a bespoke visa waiver agreement with the EU to be allowed to continue to play on in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Luke Hanrahan, Euronews, London.
